name: Don't Confuse These Movies! Trivia Game | Classic Movies | 10 Questions

questions.text: John Wayne starred with (of all people) Jennifer O'Neill in this western.
questions.explanation:
Rio Lobo.

	It was a forgettable effort - unlike "Rio Bravo", which was one of Wayne's best westerns.

questions.text: Robert Culp starred in one of the first TV movies, "Outrage". Who starred in "The Outrage", an American version of "Rashomon?
questions.explanation:
Paul Newman.

	Paul Newman was in this one. (The Culp movie wasn't bad.)

Battle Cry.

	"Cry" was a good WW II movie that starred Ray. The cast included John Lupton and Anne Francis.

questions.text: Which of these was a western that starred Glenn Ford?
questions.explanation:
Cimarron.

	"Strip" was an old TV series that starred Stuart Whitman. "City" was an even older series that starred George Montgomery.

questions.text: Anthony Hopkins starred in "The Mask of Zorro". Who starred in "The Mark of Zorro"?
questions.explanation:
Tyrone Power.

	It might be Power's best role. Linda Darnell plays the romantic interest. Williams played the character in the TV series.

questions.text: Paul Newman starred in a police drama, "Fort Apache". Who was NOT in the cast of the John Wayne western of the same name?
questions.explanation:
Joanne Dru.

	Fonda nd Wayne lock horns in this John Ford Western. An adult Shirley Temple is also on hand (along with her future husband, John Agar, who plays Ward Bond's son). Dru pops up in ""She Wore a Yellow Ribbon" and "Red River" - but she's not in this one.

questions.text: Which movie starred John Garfield and Edward G. Robinson?
questions.explanation:
The Sea Wolf.

	From the Jack London story. "Hawk" starred Errol Flynn. "Hunt" was a TV series that starred Lloyd Bridges.

questions.text: Which of these is a Bette Davis classic?
questions.explanation:
Dark Victory.

	Davis is fine as the doomed woman in "Victory". "Passage" is a Bogart and Bacall movie. "City" is Charlton Heston's first starring role.

questions.correct: Journey to the Center of the Earth
options: Journey to the Valley of the Gwangi
Journey to the Far Side of the Sun
questions.explanation:
Journey to the Center of the Earth.

	Boone and James Mason starred in this easy-to-take Jules Verne story."Far Side" and "Seventh" were also sci-fi movies. "Valley of the Gewangi" - there's no "journey" in the title - was also a sci fi.

questions.text: Which of these movies starred Jane Wyman?
questions.explanation:
Johnny Belinda.

	"Guitar" was a western that starred Joan Crawford. "Eager" was a Robert Taylor and Lana Turner movie.
